title.rendered: Find Rooms For Rent In Lubbock

content.rendered:
Known as “Hub City” to locals, people love living in Lubbock for its small-town charm and employment opportunities. Living in Lubbock offers people a dense suburban feel and most residents own their homes. If you’re thinking about moving to Lubbock, Texas, read on to learn more about average rent and finding cheap rooms for rent in Lubbock.

Related: Find Rooms for Rent in Houston

Getting to know Lubbock

Lubbock is known for its musical artists such as Buddy Holly and Waylon Jennings, a vibrant art and cultural scene, and its pleasant, welcoming ambiance. You can even nourish your love for food at the fine dining restaurants and museums. Come along for the ride as we show you all the things you need to know to enjoy this fun-filled city.

Finding rooms for rent in Lubbock

Find Rooms For Rent In Lubbock

Whether you are moving to Lubbock for a job, moving closer to your family or simply upgrading your Lubbock home – this city won’t disappoint you! Fantastic neighborhoods, high-ranked schools and a wonderful mesh of education and universities, industry and healthcare. The average rent in Lubbock, TX is $987, which means finding cheap rooms for rent in Lubbock is relatively easy.

Related: Find Rooms For Rent In Corpus Christi, TX

Top neighborhoods in Lubbock

  • Wolfforth: In a nutshell, this neighborhood is a wonderful community, with a low cost of living, low or minimal crime, and it’s 5 minutes away from the city action of Lubbock. It’s a great place to start looking for cheap rooms for rent in Lubbock.
  • Ransom Canyon: This neighborhood has a Livability Score of 86/100, which is considered exceptional. Crime rates are 86% lower than the Texas average, which makes it a safe area. Though the average rent in Lubbock is 5% lower than the Texas average, the cost of living is a bit higher.
  • Shallowater: Cost of living in Shallowater is 5% lower than the Texas average. Overall, it’s an exceptional place to live in, with affordable rental prices making it easier to find cheap rooms for rent in Lubbock.

Average rent in Lubbock

University life in Lubbock

The urban setting of the city might be best suited for students who like the fast-paced city life. Most universities offer on-campus housing, where you can choose to live in dorms as well. But if you’re looking for cheap rooms for rent in Lubbock, we’ll help you ease the process of finding the best universities in Lubbock. Here are the top 5 universities in Lubbock, Texas.

  • Texas Tech University
  • Lubbock Christian University
  • South Plains College
  • Texas Tech University Health Sciences Center
  • Wayland Baptist University

Related: Find Rooms For Rent In Austin, TX

How transit-friendly is Lubbock?

1. Walkability in Lubbock

The common Lubbock saying of being able to get anywhere in 15 minutes holds true. Lubbock has minimal public transportation and not many bike lanes. Although walkability isn’t the best, we still recommend finding your way around the city by foot. The most walkable Lubbock neighborhoods are North Overton, South Overton and Maedgen Area.

2. Taxi

A full-day hunt for cheap rooms for rent in Lubbock is made easy with Uber. It’s convenient to get around any place in the city and is a safer option. Plus, you can have some fun conversations along the way!

3. Bus

If you don’t have your own car, you can rely on CitiBus, the mass transit system in Lubbock. There are more than 10 fixed routes that run weekdays from about 6am until after 7pm, and on Saturdays from about 7am until 7:30pm. The buses don’t run on Sundays. The main transfer station is located downtown at the intersection of Broadway and Buddy Holly Avenue (also known as Avenue H).

Roomi Tip: Get a day pass to conveniently get around Lubbock. For $2.00 you can buy an unlimited day pass.

4. Car rentals

You want a great vehicle to get around Lubbock whether you’re going for a fun night out or looking for cheap rooms for rent in Lubbock. Some tips for traveling in rental cars:

  • Read the mileage policy to avoid any surprise expenses
  • Book your rental as far ahead of time as possible
  • Avoid airport pick-ups – they generally are pricier
  • Compare weekly and daily rates – you may save more if you rent the car for longer

Related: 5 Myths You Probably Believe About Living in Texas

Cultural activities in Lubbock

National Ranching Heritage Center

This center is devoted to the preservation of ranching history. The Victorian-style Barton House of 1909, a dugout residence from 1890, a log house from 1850, and a vaquero corral from 1783 are among the 40 relocated buildings on exhibit outside.

Lubbock Lake Landmark

This 300-acre archaeology and natural history preserve is a part of Texas Tech University’s Museum. It is thought to be the only location on the continent where a complete record of human history dating back 12,000 years has been unearthed. From nomadic hunters to 1800s pioneers, visitors may observe historical displays on each tribe who resided there. A four-mile nature walk and an outdoor sculpture garden are also available.

Related: Among Texas Millennials, Homeownership is Out, Renting is In

Canyon Lake Drive

On Canyon Lake Drive, visit the American Wind Power Center to observe more than 200 water-pumping windmills of all sizes, styles, and colors. A unique twin-wheel windmill and two of the largest existing windmills in North America are among the exhibits in the main gallery and outside on the museum grounds. There’s also a gift shop and an art gallery.

Restaurants in Lubbock

  • Cast Iron Grill: Located directly opposite Buddy Holly Centre is this exquisite restaurant, which mainly serves breakfast and lunch meals. Their chicken fried steak and pies are to die for!
  • The Shack: This restaurant is more than meets the eye. From the outside, it looks old and abandoned; on the inside, it’s cozy and smells delicious. Must try: loaded potato salad.
  • One Guy Pizza: For nothing but the best pizzas in Lubbock, this is the place to go. Their variety of pizzas sets them apart from every other restaurant. Whatever your preference, you’ll find it here.

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find cheap rooms for rent in Lubbock? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match!

DOWNLOAD THE APP NOW!
